cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf, aimed toward the north-central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coast) while brushing southeast Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Pearl River on the north-central Gulf Coast (eastern Louisiana / Mississippi border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: west of Shell Beach to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (includes Plaquemines Parish shoreline)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: west of the Mouth of the Pearl River to east of Morgan City LA, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with gusts to 60 mph) possible Tuesday afternoon–night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Plaquemines coastline, especially east-facing shores and tidal waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches, locally higher, could trigger flash flooding in Plaquemines Parish
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas/waves in approaches and lower Mississippi River passes; isolated tornadoes in rain bands
